00012 #define ReloadCR3() \
00013       __asm__ __volatile__ ("push %eax;mov %cr3,%eax;mov %eax,%cr3;pop %eax");
00014 
00015 #define __flush_tlb_single(addr) \
00016    __asm__ __volatile__("invlpg %0": :"m" (*(char *) addr))

00037 void page_fault (idt_call_registers_t regs)
00038 {
00039         int present   = (regs.err_code & 0x1); // Page not present
00040         int rw = regs.err_code & 0x2;           // Write operation?
00041         if (rw == 0x2) rw = 1;
00042 
00043         int us = regs.err_code & 0x4;           // Processor was in user-mode?
00044         if (us == 0x4) us = 1;
00045 
00046         int reserved = regs.err_code & 0x8;     // Overwritten CPU-reserved bits of page entry?
00047         if (reserved == 0x8) reserved = 1;
00048 
00049         int id = regs.err_code & 0x10;          // Caused by an instruction fetch?
00050         if (id = 0x10) id = 1;
00051 
00052         uint32 faulting_address;
00053         asm volatile("mov %%cr2, %0" : "=r" (faulting_address));
00054 
00055         int mapping = getMapping(faulting_address, 0);
00056 
00057         char Buffer[1024];
00058         memset(Buffer, 0, 1024);
00059 
00060         printFormattedStringToBuffer(Buffer, "Page fault at location 0x%x (present: %i write: %i us: %i reserved: %i instr: %i mapping: %i)", faulting_address, present, rw, us, reserved, id, mapping);
00061 
00062         handleFatalProcessFault(FAULT_ID_PAGEFAULT, Buffer);
00063 
00064         PANIC("Ahhh (Virtual memory manager set to crash on pagefault)\n");
00065   for (;;);
00066 }
00067 
00068 //Map the virtual address VA to the physical address PA with the appropriate flags.
00069 //VA = Virtual Address, PA = Physical Address, Flags = The flags to be set with the page.
00070 void map (MEM_LOC va,MEM_LOC pa, uint32 flags)
00071 {
00072 
00073   MEM_LOC virtual_page = (MEM_LOC)(((MEM_LOC)va) / 0x1000);
00074   PAGE_INDEX pt_idx = PAGE_DIR_IDX(virtual_page); //Page table index
00075 
00076   // Find the appropriate page table for the physical address.
00077   // If the page table does not exist then create a new one for it.
00078   if (page_directory[pt_idx] == 0)
00079   {
00080 
00081     //Null page table (Needs to be created) so allocate a frame and initialize (Null) it.
00082     page_directory[pt_idx] = (allocateFrame()) | PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER | PAGE_WRITE;
00083     
00084     //Reload the CR3 register to update virtual mappings
00085     ReloadCR3();
00086 
00087     unsigned int i = 0;
00088     
00089     for (i = 0; i < 1024; i++)
00090     {
00091         page_tables[(pt_idx * 1024) + i] = 0;
00092     }
00093 
00094   }
00095 
00096   // Now that the page table definately exists, we can update the PTE.
00097   page_tables[(MEM_LOC)virtual_page] = (((MEM_LOC)pa)) | (flags & 0xFFF);
00098  
00099   __flush_tlb_single(va);
00100 }
00101 
00102 //Unmap the virtual address VA from its physical address
00103 void unmap (POINTER va)
00104 {
00105   POINTER virtual_page = (POINTER)(((MEM_LOC)va) / 0x1000);
00106   
00107   page_tables[(MEM_LOC)virtual_page] = 0;
00108 
00109   //Signal to the CPU that a page mapping has been invalidated.
00110   __flush_tlb_single((MEM_LOC)va);
00111 }
00112 
00113 //Get whether the virtual address is mapped or not (Returns 1 or 0, true or false)
00114 //If Pa is non null sets pa to the physical address of the mapping
00115 char getMapping (MEM_LOC va, MEM_LOC *pa)
00116 {
00117   uint32 virtual_page = va / 0x1000;
00118   uint32 pt_idx = PAGE_DIR_IDX(virtual_page);
00119 
00120   // Find the appropriate page table for 'va'.
00121   if (page_directory[pt_idx] == 0)
00122     return 0;
00123 
00124   if (page_tables[virtual_page] != 0)
00125   {
00126     if (pa) *pa = page_tables[virtual_page] & PAGE_MASK;
00127     return 1;
00128   }
00129 
00130   return 0;
00131 }
00132 
00133 //Get Page entry
00134 char getPageEntry (MEM_LOC va, MEM_LOC *pa)
00135 {
00136   uint32 virtual_page = va / 0x1000;
00137   uint32 pt_idx = PAGE_DIR_IDX(virtual_page);
00138 
00139   // Find the appropriate page table for 'va'.
00140   if (page_directory[pt_idx] == 0)
00141     return 0;
00142 
00143   if (page_tables[virtual_page] != 0)
00144   {
00145     if (pa) *pa = page_tables[virtual_page];
00146     return 1;
00147   }
00148 
00149   return 0;
00150 }

00153 inline void switchPageDirectory (page_directory_t * nd)
00154 {
00155   current_pagedir = nd;
00156   asm volatile ("mov %0, %%cr3" : : "r" (nd));
00157 }
00158 
00159 inline void startPaging() 
00160 {
00161   uint32 cr0;
00162 
00163   asm volatile ("mov %%cr0, %0" : "=r" (cr0)); //Get the current value of cr0
00164 
00165   cr0 |= 0x80000000; //Bitwise or
00166  
00167   asm volatile ("mov %0, %%cr0" : : "r" (cr0)); //Set the value of cr0 to the new desired value
00168 }
00169 
00170 void markPagingEnabled() 
00171 {
00172         paging_setup = 1;
00173         paging_enabled = 1;
00174 }

00176 //Declared in virt_mm_asm.s
00177 extern void asm_disable_paging();
00178 extern void asm_enable_paging();
00179 
00180 uint32 getTable(uint32 address)
00181 {
00182         return address / PAGE_SIZE / 1024;
00183 }
00184 
00185 //Used in initialization only!
00186 //Identity maps the first page or so
00187 
00188 //TODO: Fix up this code - Possible problems = frame out of first 4mb causing a boot failure
00189 void identityMapPages(page_directory_t* pagedir)
00190 {
00191         //Map a page at the end of used memory
00192         MEM_LOC frame = allocateFrame();
00193         pagedir[0] = frame | PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER;
00194 
00195         //Create a pointer to the new page table
00196         LPOINTER pt = (POINTER) frame; //Pointer to the page directory
00197 
00198         //Iterate through, setting each page to the correct location in memories
00199         unsigned int i = 0;
00200         for (i = 0; i < 1024; i++) //Loop 1024 times so 1024 * 4096 bytes of data are mapped (4MB)
00201         {
00202                 pt[i] = (i * PAGE_SIZE) | PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER;     
00203         }
00204 
00205         //Set the KERNEL_START address to the pagedir address
00206         pagedir[getTable(KERNEL_START)] = pagedir[0];
00207 }
00208 
00214 void initializeVirtualMemoryManager(uint32 mem_end) 
00215 {
00216         unsigned int i = 0; //Used as a iterator throughout the function
00217 
00218         register_interrupt_handler (14, &page_fault); //Register the page fault handler.
00219                                                       //Called when bad little processes try to access memory they can't (Doesn't exist or not available to them)
00220 
00221         page_directory_t * pagedir = (page_directory_t *) allocateFrame(); //Paging isn't enabled so this should just give us 4kb at the end of used memory.
00222 
00223         //Null it all!!! (Clear the page directory)
00224         memset(pagedir, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
00225 
00226         //Identity map the first 4MBs of memory to KERNEL_START and 0x0
00227         identityMapPages(pagedir);
00228 
00229         // Assign the second-last table and zero it.
00230         MEM_LOC frame = allocateFrame(); //Allocate a 4KB frame
00231         pagedir[1022] = (frame & PAGE_MASK) | PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER; //Set the 1022nd page table to the new frame address
00232 
00233         LPOINTER pt = (POINTER) frame; //Pointer to the new frame
00234         memset (pt, 0, PAGE_SIZE); //Null the frame
00235 
00236         pt[1023] = ((MEM_LOC)pagedir & PAGE_MASK) | PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER; //The last entry of table 1022 is the page directory. So when paging is active PAGE_DIR_VIRTUAL_ADDR = the page directory
00237 
00238         pagedir[1023] = ((MEM_LOC)pagedir & PAGE_MASK) | PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER; //Loop back to the page directory. Causing page_tables to link back to the phyical page tables
00239 
00240         switchPageDirectory(pagedir); //Set the current page dirm
00241 
00242         startPaging(); //Paging should already be active (Higher-Half Kernel) - But just to be sure
00243 
00244         kernel_pagedir = pagedir; //Set the kernel page directory to the directory that was just created
00245 
00246         //Map where the physical memory manager keeps its stack. (Just the page table), this is because on the first expansion of the stack the map would need 2 frames while only having one (The first free page of memory) available. Bad things would follow
00247         uint32 pt_idx = PAGE_DIR_IDX((PHYS_MM_STACK_ADDR / 0x1000));
00248 
00249         frame = allocateFrame(); //Allocate a frame for the page table
00250         page_directory[pt_idx] = (frame & PAGE_MASK) | PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER;
00251 
00252         //Nulll it
00253         memset((POINTER)frame, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
00254 
00255         for (i = getTable(KERNEL_START); i < 1022; i++)
00256         {
00257                 if (page_directory[i] == 0) {
00258                         MEM_LOC address = allocateFrame();
00259                         page_directory[i] = (address & PAGE_MASK) | PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER;
00260                         ReloadCR3();
00261                 }
00262         }
00263 
00264         //Mark paging enabled (Other areas of the kernel will now consider paging to be active)
00265         markPagingEnabled();
00266 }
00267 
00268 MEM_LOC copyPage(MEM_LOC pt, process_t* process)
00269 {
00270         MEM_LOC new_page_addr = allocateFrameForProcess(process);
00271 
00272         POINTER temp_read_addr = kernelFirstFreeVirtualAddress();
00273         map(temp_read_addr, (POINTER) pt, PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER);
00274 
00275         POINTER temp_write_addr = kernelFirstFreeVirtualAddress();
00276         map(temp_write_addr, (POINTER) new_page_addr, PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER);
00277 
00278         memcpy(temp_write_addr, temp_read_addr, PAGE_SIZE);
00279 
00280         unmap(temp_read_addr);
00281         unmap(temp_write_addr);
00282 
00283         return new_page_addr;
00284 }
00285 
00286 MEM_LOC copyPageTable(MEM_LOC pt, uint8 copy, process_t* process)
00287 {
00288         MEM_LOC new_page_table = allocateFrameForProcess(process);
00289 
00290         LPOINTER temp_read_addr = kernelFirstFreeVirtualAddress();
00291         map(temp_read_addr, pt, PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER);
00292 
00293         LPOINTER temp_write_addr = kernelFirstFreeVirtualAddress();
00294         map(temp_write_addr, new_page_table, PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER);
00295         memset(temp_write_addr, 0, PAGE_SIZE);  
00296 
00297 
00298         
00299         unsigned int i = 0;
00300         for (i = 0; i < 1024; i++)
00301         {
00302                 if (temp_read_addr[i] != 0)
00303                 {
00304                         if (copy == 1)
00305                         {
00306                                 MEM_LOC New_Frame = copyPage(temp_read_addr[i], process);
00307                                 temp_write_addr[i] = New_Frame | PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER | PAGE_WRITE;
00308                         }
00309                         else
00310                         {
00311                                 temp_write_addr[i] == temp_read_addr[i];
00312                         }
00313                 }
00314                 else
00315                 {
00316                         temp_write_addr[i] = 0;
00317                         //Nufink to copy
00318                 }
00319         }
00320 
00321         unmap(temp_read_addr);
00322         unmap(temp_write_addr); 
00323 
00324         return new_page_table;
00325 }
00326 
00327 page_directory_t* copyPageDir(page_directory_t* pagedir, process_t* process) 
00328 {
00329         disable_interrupts(); //Disable interrupts
00330 
00331         page_directory_t* return_location = (page_directory_t*) allocateFrameForProcess(process);
00332 
00333         LPOINTER being_copied = kernelFirstFreeVirtualAddress();
00334         map(being_copied, pagedir, PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER);
00335 
00336         LPOINTER copying_to = kernelFirstFreeVirtualAddress();
00337         map(copying_to, return_location, PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER);
00338         memset(copying_to, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
00339 
00340         //First 4 megabytings are ID Mapped. Kernel pages are identical across all page directories. The rest gets copied
00341         copying_to[0] = being_copied[0];
00342 
00343         unsigned int i = 0;
00344         for (i = 1; i < getTable(KERNEL_START); i++)
00345         {
00346                 if (being_copied[i] != 0)
00347                 {
00348                         MEM_LOC Location = copyPageTable(being_copied[i] & PAGE_MASK, 1, process);
00349                         copying_to[i] = Location | PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER | PAGE_WRITE;
00350                 }
00351                 else
00352                 {
00353                         copying_to[i] = 0;
00354                 }
00355         }
00356 
00357         for (i = getTable(KERNEL_START); i < 1022; i++)
00358         {
00359                 copying_to[i] = being_copied[i];
00360         }
00361 
00362 
00363         // Assign the second-last table and zero it.
00364         MEM_LOC frame = allocateFrameForProcess(process);
00365         copying_to[1022] = frame | PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER;
00366 
00367         LPOINTER pt = kernelFirstFreeVirtualAddress();
00368         map(pt, frame, PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER);
00369         memset (pt, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
00370 
00371         LPOINTER opt = kernelFirstFreeVirtualAddress();
00372         map(opt, being_copied[1022], PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER);
00373 
00374         memcpy(pt, opt, PAGE_SIZE);
00375 
00376         pt[1023] = ((MEM_LOC)return_location & PAGE_MASK) | PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER; //The last entry of table 1022 is the page directory
00377 
00378         unmap(pt);
00379         unmap(opt);
00380 
00381         copying_to[1023] = ((MEM_LOC)return_location & PAGE_MASK) | PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER; //Loop back address
00382 
00383         unmap(being_copied);
00384         unmap(copying_to);
00385 
00386         return return_location;
00387 }
00388 
00389 //Search through the kernel reserved memory find a unmapped page and map it so it can be used by the kernel for some temp process
00390 POINTER kernelFirstFreeVirtualAddress()
00391 {
00392         unsigned int i = KERNEL_RESERVED_START; //Start after the IDMapped region
00393 
00394         for (i; i < KERNEL_MEMORY_END; i += PAGE_SIZE)
00395         {
00396                 if (getMapping(i, 0) == 0)
00397                 {
00398                         return i;
00399                 }
00400         }
00401 
00402         return 0; //NullPtr = FAIL
00403 }
